intro: Hibbertia truncata, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Sunshineflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Hibbertia truncata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
